Description: Murphy Oil USA agreed to spend more than $142 million to install new and upgraded pollution reduction equipment at its two petroleum refineries in Wisconsin and Louisiana as part of a comprehensive Clean Air Act settlement. The settlement also required Murphy to pay a $1.25 million civil penalty and spend an additional $1.5 million on a supplemental environmental project.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Description: The Justice Department, the Environmental Protection Agency and the Wisconsin Department of Justice announced a settlement with Murphy Oil USA, Inc. under which the company agreed to spend $7.5 million to cut sulfur dioxide emissions from its Superior, Wisconsin refinery and pay a $5.5 million civil penalty.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division

Description: Murphy Oil agreed to pay $395,312 to Louisiana and $229,687 to Wisconsin to resolve Clean Air Act violations at two petroleum refineries. These were part of a larger $144 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-murphy-oil-usa
Info Source: Murphy Oil USA Agrees to Substantially Upgrade Pollution Controls - Will Spend Over $142 Million at Refineries in Wisconsin and Louisiana, Targeted News Service, September 28, 2010 (via Nexis).
Murphy Oil's refinery in Superior agrees to pay $250,000 fine, The Associated Press State & Local Wire, May 3, 2004 (via Nexis).

Description: Murphy Oil agreed to pay $330 million to settle a class action relating to an oil spill at its refinery in Meraux, Louisiana in the wake of Hurricane Katrina.
Private Litigation Case Title: Turner v. Murphy Oil USA, Inc.

Address: SW CORNER OF U.S. HWY 98 AND HEWETT ROAD
